ZCoordinateHealthDistance: Measures the deviation of the z-coordinate from a healthy range. The more negative the value, the further the z-coordinate is from the healthy range.
FullRotationAngularVelocity: Measures the degree of rotation achieved by the ant based on its angular velocities. The more positive the value, the closer the total rotation is to a full 360 degrees.
LandingLocationAccuracy: Measures the distance from the target landing position at the origin. The more negative the value, the further the landing position is from the target.
StabilityDurationPostLanding: Measures the duration for which the ant remains stable post-landing. The more positive the value, the longer the ant remains stable after landing.
FlipDuration: Tracks the total duration of the flip. The more positive the value, the longer the flip lasts.
MaximumZCoordinateValue: Records the maximum height reached by the z-coordinate during the flip. The more positive the value, the higher the z-coordinate reached during the flip.
MeanAngularVelocityTorso: Calculates the average angular velocity of the torso. The more positive the value, the greater the average angular velocity of the torso.
CollisionImpactAssessment: Evaluates the total contact force experienced by the ant. The more negative the value, the higher the total contact force experienced.
JointMovementSmoothness: Assesses the smoothness of joint movements by evaluating changes in joint angular velocities. The more negative the value, the less smooth the joint movements are.
MaximumContactForceDuringLanding: Measures the maximum contact force exerted during landing. The more negative the value, the greater the maximum contact force experienced during landing.
EnergyUtilizationZCoordinateChanges: Estimates the energy utilization based on angular velocities and changes in the z-coordinate. The more negative the value, the higher the energy utilization related to z-coordinate changes.
PerformanceVarianceConsistencyAcrossTria: Calculates the variance in performance metrics across trials. The more negative the value, the higher the variance in performance across trials.
